page.title: 05Modern Farming
page.content: The farm is over 400 acres and has 22 fields altogether. The farmer grows barley, wheat, oats, peas, beans, fodder beet and sanfoin. The latter indigenous to the Cotswolds. He has a few cows and calves, mainly Fresian and Hereford and 14 Jacob sheep. They do not have any horses, but when they first came there used to be 10 cart horses; these were sold whsn they bought their first tractor. Today the farmer has much machinery on his farm, including 5 tractors, a combine harvester, a plough, a sprayer, trailers, harrows and a corn drier. All this means that farming today is totally mechanised and that farmers now need to be highly trained if they are to keep up with the demands of modern farming.
